DFD7B9564A3B405C8787D6F6A196ED61.description: Distinguish between theoretical probability and experimental probability, and explain the differences.

FF52B9CEEC714224BB5EB87B260B50B1.description: Explain that as the number of trials in a probability experiment increases, the experimental probability approaches the theoretical probability of a particular outcome.

D88CF6306FF841F994379718403EC8AA.description: Conduct a probability experiment, with or without technology, and compare the experimental results to the theoretical probability.

BBD6002EF30F4CA2A46BCA8F7BE3C0D5.description: Predict the probability of a given outcome occurring for a given probability experiment by using theoretical probability.

5BF82D92364342DD99381CAEB002B0D7.description: Determine the theoretical probability of an outcome occurring for a given probability experiment.

B88C3EB0FD0849C1956AD9D1786C3595.description: spinning a spinner with a given number of sectors

1C8D135518EB4406AA8EC6A042BD3E5A.description: rolling a die with a given number of sides

3A6C32EDC9B44F51B9542D2AF0D5278D.description: List the possible outcomes of a probability experiment, such as

D2F0FE9064EC4BA1B7B138F7ED68BA5B.description: comparing experimental results with the theoretical probability for an experiment

A045B5B2DB64432BA0783E198466F9EA.description: determining the experimental probability of outcomes in a probability experiment

7094998DFDC94EB28A728CD39BEFFE25.description: determining the theoretical probability of outcomes in a probability experiment

08E008C291B24039AD26289264C1AF1D.description: differentiating between experimental and theoretical probability

AA90F18444174D7F901F41AFE976D58E.description: identifying all possible outcomes of a probability experiment

E78DC55941E2424CBC9A78F6C44EE13D.description: Students will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of probability by

40286A8830D844DE92924B092E32164B.description: Gather data for a given question by using electronic media, including selecting data from databases.

0FF89EDFCD744525976C25DBDFD89406.description: Explain when it is appropriate to use a database as a source data.

7ECAC015B2B948489A019717A95D5417.description: Answer a given question by performing an experiment, recording the results, and drawing a conclusion.

07683485E9BC47E1876D17AF7A287B15.description: Design and administer a questionnaire for collecting data to answer a given question, and record the results.

6B0BCA8A77584CA4B0199D83FFF6E0F6.description: Select a method for collecting data to answer a given question, and justify the choice.

F45B1F5454FF44518AB79DCC30430195.description:
Students will be expected to select, justify, and use appropriate methods of collecting data,
including questionnaires, experiments, databases, and electronic media.

9A91794CE4724D23B1D2C90F33395F02.description: Interpret a given line graph to draw conclusions.

276C47EFC1734F61AEA7C37902B2223C.description: Create a line graph from a given table of values or a set of data.

CB8AF664A1454F1DA4866D08099FEA21.description: Determine whether a given set of data can be represented by a line graph (continuous data) or a series of points (discrete data) and explain why.

963794972D83494C8A8C56A437FFAFF2.description: Determine the common attributes (title, axes, and intervals) of line graphs by comparing a given set of line graphs.

AABFAE696CB344C0BE0695F668C2074A.description: Students will be expected to create, label, and interpret line graphs to draw conclusions.

C531BF58DBA54A8D95A4605B9FEC3D54.description: Describe the positional change of the vertices of a given 2-D shape to the corresponding vertices of its image as a result of a transformation (limited to first quadrant).

80F27665B46349C9AF851A43A2D332C0.description: Perform a transformation on a given 2-D shape, and identify the coordinates of the vertices of the image (limited to the first quadrant).

2A91DECA06334069A584F21679C5605D.description: Identify the coordinates of the vertices of a given 2-D shape (limited to the first quadrant of a Cartesian plane).

CBAAA4E9265B48F58C62556D3EC5658A.description:
Students will be expected to perform and describe single transformations of a 2-D shape in the
first quadrant of a Cartesian plane (limited to whole number vertices).

3E6F94ADCF7D4108A2C54DFBC42CA635.description: Draw shapes or designs in the first quadrant of a Cartesian plane, and identify the points used to produce them.

284AECA930D440BBADFA02B4A9C75C40.description: Determine the distance between points along horizontal and vertical lines in the first quadrant of a Cartesian plane.

81B3FEDE4D4243BEBAE560C34CA12E16.description: Draw shapes or designs in the first quadrant of a Cartesian plane, using given ordered pairs.

AE38818462A24572B85B3E11A43FD474.description: Plot points in the first quadrant of a Cartesian plane with intervals of 1, 2, 5, or 10 on its axes, given whole number ordered pairs.

D00C6ACB30F74DA1B64AB2808259E102.description: Match points in the first quadrant of a Cartesian plane with their corresponding ordered pair.

DB7DFB7D094047D194C9580921B7DD1F.description: Plot a point in the first quadrant of a Cartesian plane given its ordered pair.

FF746983091A4D739612275E76371F5D.description: Label the axes of the first quadrant of a Cartesian plane and identify the origin.

002134B916FE4A9B91153D6E824D49A7.description:
Students will be expected to identify and plot points in the first quadrant of a Cartesian plane
using whole number ordered pairs.

538632FADDF744719857FB6F54B6D640.description: Create a tessellation and describe how tessellations are used in the real world.

C9D23F061D7746A58F1FC901A273F6D5.description: Describe why a shape may or may not tessellate.

88AD648257B043A0B7DE1395B290A600.description: Create a design using one or more 2-D shapes and describe the transformations used.

F37AEAF06BFF49BDAEFD2C8C39B845F4.description: Analyze a given design created by transforming one or more 2-D shapes, and identify the original shape and the transformations used to create the design.

90312CA88CB64071A7E7F4106313D7A2.description:
Students will be expected to perform a combination of successive transformations of 2-D shapes
to create a design and identify and describe the transformations.

C9F38C66B76D4441992B79B11888D8CA.description: Perform and record one or more transformations of a 2-D shape that will result in a given image.

1CF3193B05DF452C9455E96BB211E3BA.description: Model a given set of successive transformations (translation, rotation, or reflection) of a 2-D shape.

E8883B28BBBF4A78B483DB80DDACFE6C.description: Describe the transformations performed on a 2-D shape to produce a given image.

A2830FC91B3449D3B2D660F0280DC216.description: Draw and describe a 2-D shape and its image, given a combination of transformations.

E610F0C8770845A591AD1806A75F7F62.description: Model a given combination of two different types of transformations of a 2-D shape.

3266338D394342E89CB4DB4FD119D3B4.description: Model a given set of successive translations, successive rotations, or successive reflections of a 2-D shape.

5BEDBCD13BD04EFFA153D5CEF9892E6D.description: Demonstrate that a 2-D shape and its transformation image are congruent.

A226A6EA183D4149B1424CBC9C3A36C3.description:
Students will be expected to perform a combination of translation(s), rotation(s), and/or
reflection(s) on a single 2-D shape, with and without technology, and draw and describe the image.

F7FC16FC1056432B8B5E5286752AEA79.description: Replicate a given triangle in a different orientation and show that the two are congruent.

C97B5A05C80B4C04B971D80171644041.description: Sort a given set of triangles and explain the sorting rule.

105B9EB8D8D4439F82E290E7DFC87F7C.description: Identify the characteristics of a given set of triangles according to their sides and/or their interior angles.

F029A5DBFCB94BFF96FCBEA0DE2D6D7D.description: Sort a given set of triangles according to the measures of the interior angles.

06862477F2C14E519C416A02F84950BC.description: Sort a given set of triangles according to the length of the sides.

81234C561EFC4C149323ABC278C43845.description:
Students will be expected to construct and compare triangles, including scalene, isosceles,
equilateral, right, obtuse, or acute in different orientations.

3C6D5139A534441D872FFD0BF5CFF246.description: Solve a given problem involving the perimeter of polygons, the area of rectangles, and/or the volume of right rectangular prisms.

15E77D48DB244C9C8EED65AA5A2509C3.description: Generalize a rule (formula) for determining the volume of rectangular prisms.

F817F953FC2547BC988ABBA4243E9134.description: Explain, using models, how the volume of any rectangular prism can be determined.

D27DA6EFE11646CAB14677F71DA520DC.description: Generalize a rule (formula) for determining the area of rectangles.

D5106B0F306249A7B9DA22D365514D7C.description: Explain, using models, how the area of any rectangle can be determined.

33877DCC771C4839A99B4941B584BEAF.description: Generalize a rule (formula) for determining the perimeter of polygons.

DB39482804FA48ED872A63F4A3E849BC.description: Explain, using models, how the perimeter of any polygon can be determined.

4182D82F25284374A3DA6F54CC144DE4.description: Students will be expected to develop and apply a formula for determining the

8A3CB04CF278441385B32C231BB9EEB7.description: Explain, using models, that the sum of the interior angles of a quadrilateral is the same for all quadrilaterals.

4DB58F7BE336407E90B54C19152CDD79.description: Explain, using models, that the sum of the interior angles of a triangle is the same for all triangles.

36346B2B8C8545608D84B2CD5F05FF74.description:
Students will be expected to demonstrate that the sum of interior angles is 180° in a triangle and
360° in a quadrilateral.

0387C94C4EE745CF8655FC431AE41A4F.description: Describe the measure of angles as the measure of an interior angle of a polygon.

8FAAC4FFEB3644289FB21624C7871018.description: Describe the measure of an angle as the measure of rotation of one of its sides.

B358CAB56BC04269A9A6769557242E65.description: Draw and label a specified angle in various orientations using a protractor.

06FA58206FC34521BA65E0EFF1F072D2.description: Measure, using a protractor, given angles in various orientations.

328F6E5B8FC742119F6D76ED11B02BFA.description: Estimate the measure of an angle using 45°, 90°, and 180° as reference angles.

81FB34FFF4BF450A8EFDB9E37505F5E5.description: Sketch 45°, 90°, and 180° angles without the use of a protractor, and describe the relationship among them.

E0A61A5A2A524062959A6BF70A7A3B09.description: Classify a given set of angles according to their measure (e.g., acute, right, obtuse, straight, reflex).

AE79770BBD754416A3FB8466DA7CD925.description: Identify examples of angles found in the environment.

355FA96F8A8844C39CEBB190E2BB9BFC.description: drawing and labelling angles when the measure is specified

064B71A0C74E473FA2A89880D1EDAD23.description: estimating the measure of angles using 45°, 90°, and 180° as reference angles

DB30082301B74EBA930F31C1B6182BE9.description: classifying angles according to their measure

35C26B4998DD4FA986F53A425EE097B5.description: identifying examples of angles in the environment

287CA26F7AA04724B11545EB579DF3EB.description: Students will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of angles by

44F8177EC34A4BBF8F3A944B32B18530.description: Write equivalent forms of a given equation by applying the preservation of equality and verify using concrete materials (e.g., 3b = 12 is the same as 3b + 5 = 12 + 5 or 2r = 7 is the same as 3(2r) = 3(7)).

6522CBBEC2F247D894285F47B44D97E2.description: Model the preservation of equality for division using concrete materials, such as a balance, or using pictorial representations, and orally explain the process.

F14C4ABFD86B49C2AA6DE62962C6DF77.description: Model the preservation of equality for multiplication using concrete materials, such as a balance, or using pictorial representations, and orally explain the process.

ED47BA777CA04F10B6C48F1ABA6E8934.description: Model the preservation of equality for subtraction using concrete materials, such as a balance, or using pictorial representations, and orally explain the process.

F0661B94082E4C1DBF7E03F9D1DD4BA2.description: Model the preservation of equality for addition using concrete materials, such as a balance, or using pictorial representations, and orally explain the process.

4C3C8A637F27451DBE968D1FF489CD70.description:
Students will be expected to demonstrate and explain the meaning of preservation of equality
concretely, pictorially, and symbolically.

FC1977E2834B4A2CA76A8DEBF5AF32AC.description: Represent a pattern rule using a simple mathematical expression, such as 4d or 2n + 1.

0B5EF1E9938C4061A2BB5143A5565DE7.description: Describe the relationship in a given table using a mathematical expression.

22B0F19701F34D7489B5531702942647.description: Develop and justify equations using letter variables that illustrate the commutative property of addition and multiplication (e.g., a + b = b + a or a × b = b × a).

C577AF17BDA548F2926D05D03508D537.description: Write and explain the formula for finding the area of any given rectangle.

A24647824DB94D91972984E9738B33B1.description: Write and explain the formula for finding the perimeter of any regular polygon.

4CDAB7EC87224B95852BF3C39888D596.description:
Students will be expected to represent generalizations arising from number relationships using
equations with letter variables.

07F50B23B04647BD91F22EFBF457580D.description: Describe, using everyday language, orally or in writing, the relationship shown on a graph.

DCD6031BB00249CBB0EC6883B99E1926.description: Create a table of values from a given pattern or a given graph.

14399ADA0C2C4BBEAECA85CE3B618A57.description: Translate a pattern to a table of values, and graph the table of values (limited to linear graphs with discrete elements).

D3E351908C774E48978599DCF1467831.description:
Students will be expected to represent and describe patterns and relationships, using graphs
and tables.

0C4B15DC8DB64FFDAFDD9E50760310DE.description: Create a table of values to record and reveal a pattern to solve a given problem.

C9185AA56E3B4DE48B920658F47FFB48.description: Describe the pattern within each column of a given table of values.

BA02BD9862E54943A46D004C90FBF46F.description: Identify errors in a given table of values.

95B838B6B6054060BF136AB16716DBB8.description: Identify missing terms in a given table of values.

9C6020C2472D4022957948FAC8BE100A.description: Formulate a rule to describe the relationship between two columns of numbers in a table of values.

797BB18685754F05895A01E73767EE06.description: Predict the value of an unknown term using the relationship in a table of values, and verify the prediction.

4F789C0FA87946E894F10E2CFEBD1E4D.description: Create a concrete or pictorial representation of the relationship shown in a table of values.

CFF42606AB8B40B9A4C42BF8E5140AEF.description: State, using mathematical language, the relationship in a given table of values.

FD13F268693447DEB2D6DF82119FAC21.description: Generate values in one column of a table of values, given values in the other column, and a pattern rule.

5F216D05D9BA4F059D03A4BDAB23C6E5.description:
Students will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of the relationships within tables of
values to solve problems.

4A745C37E57344B89002CB20676D5FAF.description: Apply the order of operations to solve multi-step problems with or without technology (e.g., computer, calculator).

BB47D38D5DDB4CECA0520BACC05F8F27.description: Demonstrate and explain, with examples, why there is a need to have a standardized order of operations.

6D89B9E9F2B8465E92ECDE392D3DC1D7.description:
Students will be expected to explain and apply the order of operations, excluding exponents, with
and without technology (limited to whole numbers).

C2ED2721034A40EAA5B5B363EA89737C.description: Solve a given problem, using a personal strategy, and record the process symbolically.

92902CCE675F47DF96CD3F8994D42A3B.description: Create and solve story problems that involve multiplication and division of decimals using multipliers from 0 to 9 and divisors from 1 to 9.

0D8DB2E54A61477AAF4D67736F78C8C8.description: Use estimation to correct errors of decimal point placement in a given product or quotient without using paper and pencil.

45743675F5A54173B1518E8FD384DC90.description: Place the decimal point in a quotient using front-end estimation (e.g., For $25.83 ÷ 4, think 24 ÷ 4, so the quotient is greater than $6.).

F961B5BACE934AAB8BA911754D4A0E0B.description: Place the decimal point in a product using front-end estimation (e.g., For 15.205 × 4, think 15m × 4, so the product is greater than 60.).

F1E6DC6AACDC4FB18D90AC36D8EE5F28.description: Predict products and quotients of decimals using estimation strategies.

BD0F936BE3D64FB99797169C974DDFA6.description: Model the multiplication and division of decimals using concrete and visual representations.

5EC510C444FA42B98BCDA40243EEC5C5.description:
Students will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of multiplication and division of
decimals (one-digit whole number multipliers and one-digit natural number divisors).

619AF1EE40F8481885A55C5EC3C0E3F8.description: Order given integers in ascending or descending order.

9C0396599E724A538D57E96AE632D41F.description: Compare two integers; represent their relationship using the symbols <, >, and =; and verify using a number line.

8A440167419746A1ABF73D3900949FFF.description: Describe contexts in which integers are used (e.g., on a thermometer).

3D02F91ACAA74995B409AFAD6EFFB91B.description: Place given integers on a number line and explain how integers are ordered.

948E1636A3604126B0B8C261B2ACA286.description: Extend a given number line by adding numbers less than 0 and explain the pattern on each side of 0.

388C8BEE36144FC48BB4E539F8F717BD.description:
Students will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of integers contextually, concretely,
pictorially, and symbolically.

3B8E68F6AE094C58AC69E6C282664179.description: Solve a given percent problem involving benchmarks of 25%, 50%, 75%, and 100%.

DC7C8590E5594EA88E8FB673B03220FB.description: Identify and describe percent from real-life contexts, and record them symbolically.

CE98A78A69884A01BF20AAE08769AB0F.description: Express a given percent as a fraction and a decimal.

A193F3927A4D49FF9412BCBA852B77B0.description: Record the percent displayed in a given concrete or pictorial representation.

C101ED40F329408EB5F52AAB77C6051B.description: Represent a given percent concretely and pictorially.

ADA404ADA8B940C39D313C03F2FF1D20.description: Explain that percent is a ratio out of 100.

4F46C131F9894152992AD917688D011D.description:
Students will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of percent (limited to whole
numbers) concretely, pictorially, and symbolically.

DD2463DA343C458D92527F62B1F41EF3.description: Verify that two ratios are or are not equivalent using concrete materials.

939DB24E2B164262910018335CEDA563.description: Solve a given problem involving ratio.

56065CC87B2F4647953CB844A22CB98C.description: Explain the part-whole and part-part ratios of a set (e.g., For a group of three girls and five boys, explain the ratios 3:5, 3:8, and 5:8.).

52A522D69B4D46B3A7B91A23BE5F9C27.description: Identify and describe ratios from real-life contexts and record them symbolically.

EB6C4E6DAED841E488AB4BC8172084DC.description: Express a given ratio in multiple forms, such as “three to five,” 3:5, 3 to 5, or 3 5

E332691CADC8498E856EF7BD95C2B759.description: Write a ratio from a given concrete or pictorial representation.

862EA8167ABA450F9B95F4DB6C072010.description: Represent a given ratio concretely and pictorially.

3A338AC84B334535BCB99DE76AD0491A.description:
Students will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of ratio, concretely, pictorially, and
symbolically.

A58DE2CB0EC8429C834BD01546B0DFB3.description: Represent a given mixed number using concrete, pictorial, and symbolic forms.

F97801F82A9E4478AB9E3840ABBC0EDF.description: Represent a given improper fraction using concrete, pictorial, and symbolic forms.

F756DB52C8F9489A909896BED48C78D4.description: Place a given set of fractions, including mixed numbers and improper fractions, on a number line, and explain strategies used to determine position.

E95DB0648A3F4C6BB749D365F7AC8069.description: Express mixed numbers as improper fractions.

4E7D7FF29F454778A1CEA88BF89515F8.description: Express improper fractions as mixed numbers.

6322547261BD42E4955F40D43AF90624.description: Demonstrate, using models, that a given improper fraction represents a number greater than 1.

4DA23195450144C7A7752EFEB2E26578.description:
Students will be expected to relate improper fractions to mixed numbers and mixed numbers to
improper fractions.

E1A16524D9BB4C26B21BCD0D2CA1B6E7.description: Explain why 0 and 1 are neither prime nor composite.

C0525011831F4BCF807984947B8816FB.description: Solve a given problem involving factors or multiples.

1ADA15693AC14296ABF91913A6781159.description: Sort a given set of numbers as prime and composite.

FAD9A46E4D6B40DABD1B4A6D8FAC290A.description: Provide an example of a composite number, and explain why it is a composite number.

8D555F9A293B4A34BD779A448AFA4A62.description: Provide an example of a prime number, and explain why it is a prime number.

83315BC836954B86AE9654E8278745CA.description: Identify the factors for a given number and explain the strategy used (e.g., concrete or visual representations, repeated division by prime numbers, or factor trees).

09EAADC32375472A832AA03999DE3700.description: Determine all the whole number factors of a given number using arrays.

38453D8D2EE84F768C02515E14E72490.description: Identify multiples for a given number and explain the strategy used to identify them.

5795D5B1C8AC45C99310AD26810C6F46.description: solving problems using multiples and factors

C3E9FEDD87EE4796B7F7EA30A411A3CA.description: determining multiples and factors of numbers less than 100

1FF82674E5DB467C93CF0ABA6A5BF4BF.description: Students will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of factors and multiples by

F2B7E64073244E8ABD55703DB2ECAC7D.description: Use technology, mental mathematics, or paper-and-pencil calculation to solve problems involving the addition and subtraction of decimal numbers.

C3CCFE6686814D06B66851BEF5FE9778.description: Use technology, mental mathematics, or paper-and-pencil calculation to solve problems involving the addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of whole numbers.

D86A214F02CD4575BAE201AE596BC601.description: Create problems involving large numbers and decimal numbers.

7022E628DE8A4F289B9B250F777E6DC6.description: Estimate the solution and solve a given problem using an appropriate method (technology, mental mathematics, or paper-and-pencil calculation).

C972AFFB50F4443CA76705623239D94D.description: Determine the reasonableness of an answer.

54B7764F0AF444AA901C9E6F11F1EF69.description: Identify which operation is necessary to solve a given problem and solve it.

A7781C994A6A4FC5A716963A4E54AA94.description: Determine whether technology, mental mathematics, or paper-and-pencil calculation is appropriate to solve a given problem and explain why.

F9D959D3C40145B288C7927FDFC9A94E.description: Students will be expected to solve problems involving whole numbers and decimal numbers.

1C52979B702B4477BFCE6DC361A64894.description: Provide examples of where large whole numbers and small decimal numbers are used.

A0A9B6B64BF64153BDFDDF7288F1AD66.description: Establish personal referents for large numbers.

3341714A508444FFAB2AA8A7990FA93A.description: Compare and order numbers in a variety of ways.

2D8FE2B98A174024B3414C913F2B9A57.description: Read and write given numerals in words.

B5FB8DBC20B845289AC775A8D17E3BB8.description: Represent a given number in a variety of ways, and explain how they are equivalent.

C8B72354FA7D43B9B9C0525FFA4E79B1.description: Represent a given number using expressions.

8F9AF1C070DB4E969ABAED9AB9A3934A.description: Express a given numeral in expanded notation and/or in decimal notation.

5AA26EA0AD5546CBB85D472882C53E3E.description: Record, in standard form, numbers expressed orally, concretely, pictorially, or symbolically as expressions, in decimal notation, and in expanded notation, using proper spacing without commas.

35E893228E3C47269D1826EB9D428AC7.description: Read a given numeral in several ways.

41382724B941468EBDE21DD2F8650FAF.description: Explain the meaning of each digit in a given numeral.

FE0EA78048174DB8BD7C02248EB9E16A.description: Represent a given numeral using a place-value chart.

7B0068181D904847916B446DE574D373.description: Describe the pattern of adjacent place positions moving from right to left and from left to right.

58E11D36C4234459A0E505510910548F.description: Explain how the pattern of the place-value system (e.g., the repetition of ones, tens, and hundreds) makes it possible to read and write numerals for numbers of any magnitude.

30B85176562B4DA9B6AD799DB894BFF5.description:
Students will be expected to demonstrate an understanding of place value for numbers greater
than one million and less than one-thousandth.
